revised_title: Honorary Degree Ceremonies for the Tercentenary of the Royal Society
tldr: The article discusses the honorary degree ceremonies held at the Universities of Oxford, Cambridge, and London to celebrate the Tercentenary of the Royal Society. Distinguished scientists from around the world received honorary degrees, emphasizing the international character of science and its contributions to peace and happiness. The article highlights the importance of maintaining a well-balanced proportion of various scientific disciplines for the well-being of mankind.
